name: places/ChIJt38c1PBZwokREI37gQGNsXg
formattedAddress: 62 Crosby St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 62 Crosby St, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text:
I am not a gym person at all and haven't stepped in a gym for at least a decade, or more. I walk, bike, and do yoga mostly. But I decided to try Orange Theory to get in some resistance training and to push myself a bit more. The idea of exercising according to the science appealed to me and my doctor said I could use some more anaerobic exercise. I tried a class at the Soho location and absolutely loved it, and the instructor. I signed up for a package of classes on sale (which never expire) and that will give me a few months to try it out before committing to a monthly membership.

In short, I have loved the experience so far. The one thing I notice right away, after taking a couple of classes, is that my body feels the effects of the workout but I'm not in pain nor have I injured myself pushing things too far, too fast. That is a testament to the method and to the instructors who ensure you are in good form while challenging you into your "orange" zone and beyond sometimes.

originalText.text: The entire management/coaching staff has been exceptionally welcoming since my first class. I had never been able to stick to a workout regiment for more than a couple of weeks until I came to OTF Soho. The environment is what really stands out for me. The staff is always greeting everyone with a smile, the coaching is motivational/informative, and the workout is competitive but not intimidating.

text.text: The entire management/coaching staff has been exceptionally welcoming since my first class. I had never been able to stick to a workout regiment for more than a couple of weeks until I came to OTF Soho. The environment is what really stands out for me. The staff is always greeting everyone with a smile, the coaching is motivational/informative, and the workout is competitive but not intimidating.

originalText.text: I was visiting New York City and decided to go to this studio since it was the closest OTF to our hotel. The vibe of this studio is very different from the other ones I have visited, with the big glowing Splat as soon as you enter. I almost missed the 'Soho' mural on the other wall, which is pretty cool! The SAs were very friendly, and acknowledged my birthday the minute I signed in. Coach Frankie was very engaging, and corrected forms on the weight floor pretty often. This studio also provides complimentary workout and shower towels, which not all studios do. As I was heading out after the workout, the SA gave me a SoHo OTF waterbottle for my birthday! As someone who collects a lot of OTF swag, I really appreciated this gesture. Highly recommend trying a workout here!

originalText.text:
THANK YOU-MANHATTAN - SOHO- CROSBY ST
Great to visit NYC and get my OT workout on the road. Incredible class run by Coach Brian. Welcomed into class by staff and coach for benchmark day for 500m row! Coach Brian runs a great class. Incredible energy for the class and got  us all to work for the Orange Zone. Facility supplies towels for the work out and showers after.
I will be back. Plan your next visit to NYC with work out at SOHO- CROSBY ST Orangetheory

originalText.text: Great workout..great trainers, i like that i can travel and still find an orange theory wherever i go
